title.narrative: Improvement of agricultural production through strengthening of agricultural extension services, increased technical inputs and promotion of decent and safe jobs in rural areas

description.narrative:
The proposed Project “Improvement of agricultural production through The proposed Project will kick off the ground quickly as it is the (i) Strengthening of Agricultural Extension Service;The proposed Project
(ii) Increased technical inputs; The Project will prov ide a support to The project will take advantage of the UNISWORK-XI project implemented increased technical inputs and strengthening of agricultural extension services” will be implemented in selected villages of one province and will be built on the strengths and lessons learned from UNDP programming in Kyrgyzstan during the last several years. continuation of the UNDP-interventions that started in 2010 and will be built on already existing infrastructure and capacities available in the provinces to assist the effective and efficient implementation of the Project’s outputs. will assist small farmers and home gardeners in the fruits sector to strengthen domestic agricultural practices through intensive capacity building of agricultural producers on improved knowledge and skills about fruit tree management, crop-production technologies for better quality raw material. The Project will expand the network of village-based agricultural extension services centers and improve knowledge and skills of selected agricultural extension agents. It is envisaged that in longer term these agents would continue serving as resource persons for local farmers and provide on-going consultative support. Capacities of consultants in villages will be strengthened in crop-productionand entrepreneurship through usage of educational organizations, and conducting seminars “Start and Improve Your Business”. poor farmers in sustainable agriculture practices to enhance and diversify sources of income. This will include increasing technical inputs to improve productivity/yield of grains, fruit trees, etc, and establishing micro-processing units for each community.Fruit drying facilities will be created to kick start the process and technical support will be provided to establish sustainable value-chain mechanisms, linking production and processing stages with packaging, sales and marketing of goods within selected provinces and beyond. The SHG, ASHGs and CMCs will be actively involved in the mobilization activities that will include: repeated communal meetings, setting the foundation for consistent, quality raw material base for the drying facility. by UNIDO and expose trainers to a ToTprogramme on fruit drying technologies allowing them to benefit from international exchange and creation of sustainable linkage to an internationally acting support institution.
